The minstrel of melodies is my name,
For a mere ${number: 6} gil I'll recall your past.
Your stories of love, anger, triumph, and shame,
The river of memories runs deep and vast.${prompt}
The minstrel of melodies is my name,
For a mere ${number: 6} gil I'd recall your past.
But I find that you're lacking in cash or in fame,
So until that time, my kind offer will last.${prompt}
Which memory will you have recalled?
Which memory will you have recalled?
Which memory will you have recalled?
Which memory will you have recalled?
Which memory will you have recalled?
Hmph. I see the boy is not with you...${prompt}
Very well. Let us put our differences aside for the moment.
However, I suggest that you do not make any sudden movements, as we are being watched...${prompt}
Travelers. This place is nothing but a memory fleeting on the edge of time. There is little we have to offer outsiders.${prompt}

And so I must ask of you these questions: From where have you come, and to where do you go? If your conscience is clean and your intentions just, you should have no reason not to provide me with answers.${prompt}
Yeah! A fight to the death!${prompt}
What, you say that these Tarutaru stole something from you?${prompt}
Stealing items from an unconscious stranger! What were you three thinking!?${prompt}
But that amulet is Prishe's! I bet that funny-looking adventurer stole it from her!${prompt}
It does closely resemble the one Prishe had in her possession...${prompt}
We shall wait for Prishe's return. She will know whether the amulet is hers or not.
Until that time, I suggest that you rest here in the safehold.${prompt}
However, remember that you are not welcome, and the moment the issue at hand is solved, you will be asked to leave and never come back.${prompt}
Welcome to our humble city, though there is little left of it...
I heard from Justinius the details of your predicament.${prompt}
He mentioned that you were from the mainland.${prompt}
Tell me, what is the situation beyond the churning seas?${prompt}
I see... ${choice: 0}[The lord of the beastmen has returned and/Even after the Shadow Lord's defeat,] the struggle for peace continues.${prompt}
No one has the time to wonder about the fates of their lost brothers...${prompt}
This is Tavnazia... A new Tavnazia, built from the ruins of the once mighty Marquisate. For twenty years, the survivors of the Great War toiled to create what you see here.${prompt}
For twenty years, we have dug and carved our way up from a narrow storageway below the Tavnazian Cathedral...${prompt}
As an adventurer, I am sure you have heard tales of the Pearl of Zafmlug--the renowned Tavnazian Marquisate.${prompt}
Her wide harbors would welcome ships from all corners of Vana'diel, carrying never-before-seen goods and treasures.${prompt}
A mecca of trade. A place where dreams of wealth and success could become reality... It was the golden age of Tavnazia.${prompt}

But it all came to a close twenty years ago. The beastman hordes concentrated their attack on our fair nation, and when they were through, there was nothing left but a wasteland uninhabitable by even the foulest of creatures.${prompt}
We, too, should have met the same fate as the Marquisate...${prompt}
Late in our escape from the peninsula, we made for the cathedral, where we awaited our deaths at the hands of the Orcs.${prompt}
However, it was not the Orcs who arrived, but the cardinal, Mildaurion C Giloumet.${prompt}
She tended to our wounded bodies and spirits, and informed us how to escape.${prompt}
She opened the gates to the lower parts of the cathedral, and told us to follow the delivery tunnels to the city.${prompt}
We did as we were told, and it was not long before we arrived at the subterranean harbor deep beneath this place.${prompt}
However, by the time we had arrived, the boats had already gone, and a terrible explosion had destroyed the landbridge to Quon... We were trapped...${prompt}
But even with our backs against the wall of despair, the courage and faith we had received from the cardinal remained in our hearts.${prompt}
For the past twenty years we have survived on the belief that Altana will save us. It is that belief that has helped us to come together and rebuild our nation.${prompt}
However, we still struggle to provide for even ourselves. I am sorry we cannot offer you any more than a warm welcome.${prompt}
But please, feel free to utilize any of our facilities.${prompt}
I pray that the powers that led you to Tavnazia become a blessing for both our peoples.${prompt}
I realize that back on the mainland, no one has the time to wonder about the fates of their lost brothers.${prompt}
However, I pray that the powers that led you to Tavnazia turn out to be a blessing for both our peoples.${prompt}
...By the way, where is the other traveler that arrived with you here in the safehold?${prompt}
I wish to hear his tales of the mainland as well...${prompt}
You say that Nag'molada fellow is not an acquaintance of yours?${prompt}
Well, that is of no matter. If you happen to see him again, I strongly suggest you warn him not to go anywhere near the door leading to the aqueducts.${prompt}
So this is what remains of the mighty nation of Tavnazia... Its people alone behind these walls, struggling to stay alive for the past twenty years...${prompt}
Hey you! We know who you really are! Tell us who you really are!${prompt}
You're one of those bad, bad rogues!${prompt}

Ulmia is a very strong-willed young woman. She understands the responsibilities that lie before her and will not cower before them.${prompt}
That is why she blamed herself for not knowing more about the painting of Al'Taieu kept in the Tavnazian Cathedral's reliquiarium.${prompt}
Lady Ulmia is not a theologian of the cathedral. No one expects her to know of the painting. However...${prompt}
Exactly! There is no way she could know of the painting. She was only a mere child when the piece was donated to the cathedral. Oh, why must you blame yourself, poor Ulmia?${prompt}
Sir Louverance! I know some of the history behind the painting. Let me tell you of what I know.${prompt}
Long ago, I helped in the transport of the relic to the cathedral. Much tumult arose as a result of bringing that painting here.${prompt}
Your assistance is greatly appreciated, Despachiaire. I will relay everything you tell me to your granddaughter.${prompt}
It was some twenty-five years ago that the painting was brought to the archipelago.${prompt}
According to the Marquisate officials, the painting was found deep within ancient ruins known as the Temple of Uggalepih.${prompt}
It is said that the painting depicts a scene in the verse of a legendary song--the ancients and their attempt to open the Gates of Paradise...${prompt}
Yes, I remember it like it was yesterday...
A gate of light hovering over a grand city...
The gatekeeper roaring to the heavens...${prompt}
The gatekeeper took the shape of a mighty dragon. However, his four legs were bound by mighty shackles.${prompt}
This image was the strongest in the painting. Many of the missionaries that came to view the painting would often call it the relic of chains, or the relic of the dragon.${prompt}
So at that time the identity of the city was still unknown...${prompt}
Yes, until Cardinal Mildaurion viewed the painting. It was she who told us the city was Al'Taieu.${prompt}

As punishment for defying the gods, the city of Al'Taieu was destroyed and banished to the bottom of the northern sea. After the cardinal revealed the truth of the painting, many a canticle was sung of this legend. There wasn't a soul in Tavnazia who had not heard one while sipping down a glass of brew in the local pub.${prompt}
However... Why did the cardinal know of the city and its legend?${prompt}
Though I may be mistaken, I seem to recall that before arriving in Tavnazia, Mildaurion was a priest who wandered the Outlands on a quest for spiritual enlightenment.${prompt}

I have also heard tales that many of the holy relics that reached the archipelago were brought from the Outlands by thieves and pirates. Perhaps the cardinal obtained her knowledge of Al'Taieu in these forsaken areas.${prompt}
Yes, I also remember how a group of Mithra came from those Outlands, demanding that we return the painting to the temple.${prompt}

I, too, have heard that tale. After a long series of talks, the cardinal was able to convince the Mithra to allow the painting to remain in Tavnazia, without defacing the honor of the cathedral.${prompt}
We were relieved, and with those Mithra beasts gone, we could go back to our normal, everyday lives.${prompt}
Perhaps they know more of the painting...${prompt}
Despachiaire, would you happen to recall the names of the Mithra or where exactly they came from?${prompt}
I do not remember their names. I do not think they were ever referred to by anything other than the title of “sin hunters.”${prompt}
Sin hunters. Assassins sent from the Mithran homeland to do the dirty work of the Grand Chieftainness...${prompt}
So this painting must be of great importance to their race...${prompt}
A young Mithran sin hunter visited the safehold a number of days ago.${prompt}
If you can find her, she may be able to better inform you of the secrets behind the painting.${prompt}
Despachiaire, I thank you very much for your assistance. I will heed your advice and begin a search for this Mithra.${prompt}
A sin hunter in Tavnazia... A quite unexpected turn of events, wouldn't you say, ${name-player}?${prompt}
Let us travel to Windurst and inquire with the chieftainness about the sin hunters and the painting they desire.${prompt}

If you can find her, perhaps she may be able to better inform you of the secrets behind the painting.${prompt}

I cannot imagine for what reasons she visited us. However, if you can find her, she may be able to better inform you of the secrets behind the painting.${prompt}

When my homeland was destroyed during the Great War, I realized my life was over. Yes, I have my new home here in the safehold, but not a day goes by that I do not wish I could return to the days of past.${prompt}
I understand that I will never be able to go back, but there is a part of me that doesn't want to believe...${prompt}

I could never say no. You should have seen the smile on her face when she was gathering flowers. It was the most beautiful...${prompt}
Until one day she was taken...
Not three yalms from where I rest in the shade, a terrible beast appeared out of nowhere, lifted her up, and carried her off into the nearby forest.
A search party was formed, but she was never found...${prompt}
It has been almost five years since I last saw her, but there are still no signs of whether or not she survived...
I would go out and search for her myself, but I am untrained in the ways of battle.${prompt}

It is my fault that our daughter is gone...${prompt}

He was quite a fine craftsman...until we lost our daughter.${prompt}

Lately those two have not been on the best of terms. I worry about them almost every day...${prompt}

But she's simply too proud to show her true feelings.${prompt}
Did you know that the search parties used that wristlet to try and locate Frescheque and Raminey's daughter?${prompt}

I wonder if it is about time we finally give up hope...${prompt}

Not many people have seen one, but they do exist...${prompt}

Here, I have a surprise for you.${prompt}

My father--your grandfather--showed one to me when I was just about your age.${prompt}

I'll never forget the smile on her face... The sparkle in her eyes...${prompt}
Now, perhaps...she can rest in peace...${prompt}
Please, take this as a token of my gratitude.
I'm truly sorry that I don't have anything more to reward you for your kindness.${prompt}

Why, you're the adventurer that came by the other day asking about Frescheque and Raminey.${prompt}

I come to this place often to gaze up at the sky...${prompt}

As long as we are bound by the past, we will never be able to step forward into the future.

The change the safehold has experienced recently... It has all been so sudden.

The world around us may change, but the people living in it will always stay the same...${prompt}
The world around us may change, but the people living in it will always stay the same...${prompt}

I appreciate all the aid coming in from Jeuno, but I miss the peace and quiet of the old Tavnazia. With all the scruffy travelers constantly coming up to me asking for this and that, I can't concentrate on my daily chores!${prompt}
I suppose your travels have taken you to the four corners of Vana'diel--across towering mountains and vast oceans...${prompt}

We risk our lives to ensure that Tavnazia will carry on, no matter what obstacles may arise.${prompt}
However, all we hear from the village elders is how wonderful the Tavnazia of old was--how they all wish they could return to the time before the war.${prompt}
As much as I try to understand how they feel, I cannot help but be angered by their lack of appreciation for what we work so hard to bring them.${prompt}
Why must they drag around the past?${prompt}
What is wrong with what we have now?${prompt}
If you are interested in such tales, why not try speaking with the elders of the safehold?${prompt}
Why, Lady Equette is always reminiscing of times forgotten...${prompt}
Wait a minute, are you one of those adventurers?${prompt}
Hey, did you know that I'm training to be an adventurer, too?${prompt}
One of these days, I'm gonna set out and find some buried treasure! And when I do, I'm gonna divide it among everybody here in the safehold so they can have better lives.${prompt}
I'm ready to go right now, but my mom and dad say that I'm still too young to go outside...${prompt}
I wish I was older so I could join the Tavnazian Patrol like my brother...${prompt}
Sometimes he tells me stories about battles with horned beasts, green giants, and all sorts of neat-sounding monsters.${prompt}
But even he won't let me go with him on scouting missions to the nearby forests or cliffs.${prompt}
I haven't even seen the ocean...
You've been to the ocean, haven't you? I heard it's filled with lots of mysterious treasures.${prompt}
My brother also told me that monsters like to collect those treasures. When he defeats one, he says that it sometimes drops a rare item from the sea!${prompt}
If I could get my hands on one of those treasures, I could help everybody out! But, I don't know if I could take out one of those monsters by myself...${prompt}
My brother said that he once saw a beast carrying a strange spirally shell on its back. I bet we could sell that for a lot of gil!${prompt}
You found a spirally shell, just like my big brother told me about. I wonder if it makes any sound when you blow into it.${prompt}
It's all interesting-looking, but if it doesn't make any sound, then what good is it?${prompt}
Leporaitceau! I wasn't doing anything! I wasn't doing anything!${prompt}
Ante, what did I tell you about playing with other people's belongings!${prompt}
But this isn't someone else's belongings, it's this adventurer's belongings! ${choice-player-gender}[He/She] found it near the cliffs.${prompt}
And why would a complete stranger give you, of all people, ${choice-player-gender}[his/her] belongings?${prompt}
I think you've had enough fun for today, Ante. Now I'll take that shell until we can find out who this really belongs to.${prompt}
Hey! You can't do that! It's not fair!${prompt}
Life isn't always fair now, is it?${prompt}
Hm? Lady Equette spoke of a shell that carried in it the sound of the sea?${prompt}
Well, we cannot know if this is the shell she spoke of unless we ask her, can we?${prompt}
Let us take it to her at once.${prompt}
Wait! You can't go without me!${prompt}
This adventurer here found that spirally shell by the ocean!${prompt}
According to ${choice-player-gender}[his/her] testimony, the adventurer found the shell after defeating a terrible beast on the Misareaux Coast.${prompt}
Listen to the sounds of the emerald seas.${prompt}
These are the sounds I remember. These are the sounds of Tavnazia.${prompt}
When I grow up, I'm going to see what's on the other side of the ocean.${prompt}
Lady Equette. I would like you to have this shell.${prompt}
No, I cannot accept it. I was able to hear the call of the sea once again. That is all I desired.${prompt}
I am moved by your generosity, Leporaitceau. Are you sure it would be alright?${prompt}
I wish I could have a neat shell like that one...${prompt}
Your room is filled with conch shells that I brought back from my missions.${prompt}
Yeah, but none of those sound like the ocean...${prompt}
And you'll never be one until you can respect one!${prompt}
Alright. How about I take you out to the ocean when you turn twelve next year?${prompt}
If I promise to do that, will you agree to let Lady Equette keep the shell?${prompt}
But if you're pulling my leg, I'll...I'll...${prompt}
Young Anteurephiaux, I would like to thank you. Here. Please take this as a token of my appreciation.${prompt}
It is a muffler. But not an ordinary muffler. It is said to hold the power to protect travelers on their journeys.${prompt}
It was the power of this garment that led me to this safehold twenty years ago...${prompt}
Then this must be really important!${prompt}
Yes. I do believe it is. Do you think you have the courage and strength to keep it safe?${prompt}
Actually, I think there's someone who deserves this more than I do. Here, ${choice-player-gender}[Mr./Ms.] Adventurer, you can have it.${prompt}
Why, what a kind gesture. I am very proud of you.${prompt}
Hear that, Leporaitceau? She's proud of me! Me, not you!${prompt}
When I grow up, I'm going to be a super adventurer, just like my new best friend!${prompt}
Lately I spend my days reminiscing of the past...
Ah, how beautiful the Marquisate was... If I could only take you there...${prompt}
Recently, the light that shines down on the safehold seems brighter than it has been in ages.
<Sigh> I wonder if Tavnazia will ever regain the glory of old...${prompt}
There's nothing to do in this musty old cave. I wanna go outside and play in the meadows!${prompt}
I've heard lots of neat stories from all the adventurers visiting the safehold. I can't wait until I'm old enough to ditch this smelly cave and go someplace exciting!${prompt}
I will not rest until the Marquisate has become as grand and as powerful as it was before the Great War!${prompt}
With the arrival of the airships, the situation in Tavnazia has begun to take a turn for the better.${prompt}
Once again Vana'diel will hear the roar of the mighty sealion!${prompt}
I wonder if I'll ever have the chance to catch the “big one” before I cross that final river to Paradise...${prompt}
${choice-player-gender}[Laddie/Lassie], have you ever dreamed of reeling in the impossible? Hooking the beast that legends are made of?${prompt}
Vegetarian!? I don't have any business with you leaf-eaters! Move along!${prompt}

Not but a few days ago, a young adventurer stopped by the safehold saying that she spotted an enormous “something” swimming in the waters of Lufaise Meadows. She mentioned that she tried to fish the beast up, but was unsuccessful.
Just hearing that fish tale started my blood a-boiling.${prompt}

I don't mean to blow my own horn, but when I was still a young 'un, there wasn't a soul in Tavnazia that didn't know the name Trawlin' Travonce. I was the finest fisherman on the whole peninsula.${prompt}
And I still am, but my skills with the sword have dropped off a wee bit in these past few years.${prompt}

With all the crazed beastmen roaming the islands and the savage monsters lurking below the waters, an old man can no longer just sit back and enjoy a day casting his line on the emerald waters of Tavnazia.${prompt}

Now, if some nice strong young adventurer would come out with me and take care of all the pests while I fished, good ol' Trawlin' Travonce could snatch up the “big one” in the blink of an eye, give or take a few blinks.${prompt}
${color-alt: 15}Travonce looks at you with puppy-dog eyes.${prompt}
Will no one grant an old man his final wish before he withers away and dies...alone...and fishless?${prompt}
What a kind young child you are!
I'll go gather my equipment. You know what they say, an unprepared fisherman is a...a...${prompt}
Anyway, you'd better go make your preparations as well. When you're ready, I'll be waiting at the Porte d'Altendise.
What, you don't know where that is? There are four exits in the northern end of the safehold, right? Porte d'Altendise is the southeastern one.${prompt}
Oh, and I like to sleep in, so don't show up until after lunchtime. But don't come too late. We have to find that fish before he swims off somewhere to sleep.${prompt}
Young adventurers these days... No respect for their elders. And to top that off, they're all nothing but a lot of spineless jellyfish, to boot!${prompt}
And so the big one got away again... Maybe I am getting too old for this...${prompt}

Ah, that's right. I guess I should give you something in return for helping me out. How about this fishing gear? It doesn't look like an old, washed-up geezer like me will be needing it any more...${prompt}
At least I had the opportunity to go out under the crisp, clean Tavnazian sky one last time before I die... <Sigh>...${prompt}

The other day, a fine young ${choice-player-gender}[man/lady] helped me go out in search of the “big one.” Come to think of it, ${choice-player-gender}[he/she] looked an awful lot like you...${prompt}
Why, you look like an energetic ${choice-player-gender}[lad/lass], all chock full o' pep. If I could only find myself someone like you to help an old man fulfill his final wish...${prompt}
Don't tell me that you're having second thoughts.
Maybe it's time I just went somewhere to crawl up and die...${prompt}
Leave him to crawl up and die?
This safehold we all live in now was once part of the Tavnazian Cathedral, as were the Sealion's Den and the Sacrarium.${prompt}
Aid from Jeuno has begun arriving in our city. While these items may improve our ways of life at the moment, many of us still worry about the future of the safehold.${prompt}
Have you ever journeyed to the Sacrarium?${prompt}
Since I was a child, it has been my dream to become an architect. I often walk alone to the Sacrarium's libraries to study the books on ancient architecture.${prompt}
One day, while reading a volume on Tavnazian masonry, I discovered a tattered old set of floorplans.${prompt}

However, due to its condition, there were many sections of it that were difficult to make out. If we could find another copy, I might be able to construct a new map of the Sacrarium based on the combined sets of plans.${prompt}
If you happen to come across even a fragment of a document that may be of use, bring it back to me and I will do my best to piece together the puzzle.${prompt}
Yes, this looks similar to the set of plans I found before... But it, too, is damaged terribly. I cannot tell exactly which part of the Sacrarium it describes.${prompt}
Hm? You say you found this document in a treasure chest?${prompt}
Do you happen to remember in what area of the Sacrarium the chest was located?${prompt}
There is a good chance that the plans describe the same area.${prompt}
Where did you find the chest?
Where did you find the chest?
Where did you find the chest?
Where did you find the chest?
I will use that information to attempt to reconstruct a precise map of the area. It will take me about a day to complete my work. Please come back tomorrow.${prompt}
It will take me about a day to complete my work on the map of the Sacrarium. Please come back tomorrow.${prompt}
I apologize. The information you provided was not precise enough for me to finish the map.${prompt}
If you happen to come across any more pieces of the Sacrarium floorplans, please bring them to me. I will not give up until I've created a perfect map!${prompt}
I never imagined that the area could be so simple, yet complicated...${prompt}
This has been a wonderful experience for me. I have learned so much about the architecture of the cathedral.${prompt}
Feel free to take the map with you. I have already made myself a copy.
It is the least I can do.${prompt}
I shall make sure to preserve it with the care due the most precious of research materials.${prompt}

Would you take a look at those fuzzy guys over there? Can you believe that they'd come all the way from their cozy homes in Moogle-land to a town in the middle of nowhere? They must be really crazy or really bored.${prompt}

Now that the airships from Jeuno have started arriving, there are a lot more people passing through the safehold. Those fuzzy guys over there seem pretty happy considering all the extra work.${prompt}
You know about what happened to Cape Riverne, right?${prompt}
Well, did you know that there's this traveling Goblin that's trying to make a new map of the area? Bet you didn't!${prompt}
And I also bet you didn't know it was that Goblin who gave the areas their strange names--Site #A01 and Site #B01.
Yeah, I just met the cute little girl a couple of days ago. She came to the safehold wanting to buy some supplies for her journey.${prompt}
She said that she was almost done with the map, but still hadn't finished trekking through the most dangerous part of the area.${prompt}
Now that I think of it, there's no way that sweet Gobmuffin can possibly make it on her own...
Hey, you're a strong-looking adventurer. Would you go to Cape Riverne and see if you can find her and bring her back? It's a matter of life or death!${prompt}
Would you go to Cape Riverne and see if you can find that sweet Gobmuffin and bring her back? It's a matter of life or death!${prompt}
You were attacked by what!? A strange pack of Moblins!?
Swikastoqq wentt to chase away badd Moblinns.${prompt}
But, what were you thinking going out there again. You could've been hurt...or even worse!${prompt}
Oh, I'm sorry. Let me introduce you. This is my cutie Gobli--I mean Moblin buddy.${prompt}
She came back here right after you left. She said that something happened on the cape, but I couldn't get her to tell me what it was.${prompt}
I didn't want the other townspeople to worry, so I've been hiding her in this vacant storage room.${prompt}
Badd Moblinns wantedd to keepp secretts of site to themselves.${prompt}
Thatt's why they triedd to kill Swikastoqq!${prompt}
So I give Tavnazia lady mapp.${prompt}
Andd I give otherr Moblinns mapp, too.
But are you going to be okay?
What will happen if you go back to your hometown?
You can always stay here with me...${prompt}
Swikastoqq wantedd to know more aboutt upworldd, so Swikastoqq leftt home.${prompt}
Journey wass hardd. Journey wass lonely. Butt Swikastoqq hadd funn. Swikastoqq wantss to telll Moblinns aboutt funn.${prompt}
I guess if that's your dream, I'm not going to stand here and hold you down.
You know. I really didn't do anything at all. I don't deserve this map...
You're an adventurer, right? Then maybe this map is better served in your hands?
What? You've already got one? Then I'll hold onto it in case some other lost soul comes wandering by.${prompt}
And if in your travels you ever see my buddy again, tell her that I said hi...and that I hope I can see her again someday...${prompt}
I wonder if my little buddy's okay...${prompt}
Ah, what am I worried about. She's got more brains in her pinky than I do in my pocket!
She'll make it back to her hometown. I'm sure of it!${prompt}
It is not only the adults of the safehold who wish to improve our current situation--many of the younger men and women are also trying to make a difference.${prompt}
However, what they fail to realize is that cowering behind the walls of the city won't change anything...${prompt}
My name is Ferchinne. I was tired of seeing my people suffer, so I decided to journey forth from the confines of the safehold in order to earn the title of Dragon Slayer.${prompt}

I trained for many months, but I feel I still lack the skills needed to defeat a truly horrifying dragon. To be a true Dragon Slayer, one must be able to soar like a dragon, not only physically, but mentally.${prompt}
Perhaps I need wings of my own to catch the winds of the endless skies...${prompt}
The city elders told me that once, long ago, there were knights in the Kingdom of San d'Oria that could fly as high as the clouds.${prompt}
Brave adventurer, have you ever seen a noble bird that walks on four legs? A proud beast that has the wings of an eagle?${prompt}
If you come across one of these mythical creatures, I would greatly appreciate it if you removed its tailfeathers and brought them back here to me.${prompt}
It is said that while those feathers are unbelievably light, they are remarkably sturdy. If I were to bond them together with wax, I could make wings of my own!${prompt}
Bring back two and I will reward you with something special.${prompt}
The luster, the touch... Yes, these are the feathers that I have been searching for. Thank you so very much. Now, maybe I can fly as high as the dragons themselves!${prompt}
Here, take this as a token of my appreciation.${prompt}
I was given that stone by an old merchant while traveling through the Eastern empire. He told me that it had the power to dissolve the clouds and rob mighty dragons of their ability to fly.${prompt}
But even if it does not have that power, I'm sure you can find someone who will purchase it from you for a large sum of gil.${prompt}
Will I ever be able to fly...
I am sorry to bother you again, but if you come across any more of the legendary tailfeathers, I beg of you to bring them to me.${prompt}
Oh, whatever am I to do...?${prompt}
Excuse me, but do you think you could help me?${prompt}
I was going to give an offering to the Goddess for my dear friend who passed away three years ago. However, the hairpin I was to offer is missing.${prompt}
I know you must be busy with your adventuring, but if you happen to spot it, please bring the hairpin back to me. I would be extremely grateful.${prompt}
Lady Elysia, what are you doing all the way down here?${prompt}
I...uh... I was listening to the tales of this adventurer.${prompt}
${choice-player-gender}[Sir/Ma'am], this may seem like an odd question, but...${prompt}
We have not met before, have we?${prompt}
I apologize for being so abrupt.${prompt}
During the Great War twenty years ago, I suffered a terrible injury and lost all my memories of the past.${prompt}
That is why every time I meet someone new, I ask them if we ever met.${prompt}
Ah, yes. One last circle of the area near the altar and I will be done.${prompt}
Well, as much as I would like to stay and hear the tales of your journeys, I must finish my rounds. Good day, ${choice-player-gender}[sir/ma'am].${prompt}
Might we have stew tonight? I do love your homemade stew.${prompt}
Ah, I'm sorry. For a moment there I was lost in thought...${prompt}
I might have dropped it while carrying groceries from the upper level of the safehold.${prompt}
I do hope you are able to find it...${prompt}
I might have dropped the hairpin while carrying groceries from the upper level of the safehold.
I do hope you are able to find it...${prompt}
There is nothing out of the ordinary here.${prompt}
I was beginning to think I would never see this again. Thank you so much...${prompt}
Kind adventurer, do you have a moment?${prompt}
I told you before that I was going to present this hairpin as an offering to the Goddess.${prompt}
Twenty years ago, I lost one of my dear friends to the flames of the Great War.${prompt}
No... The war did not take her life...${prompt}
It was I who killed her.${prompt}
Mischanau had just married, but she was very weak. While her husband, a member of the Tavnazian Knights, was on duty, I would often visit her residence and take care of her.${prompt}

However, one day, the beastmen armies broke through the city's defenses and began their plundering and pillaging. I grabbed my friend's hand and began to flee with all the rest of the townspeople.${prompt}

Overcome by the crowds of people trying to escape the Orcs' arrows, I accidentally let go of Mischanau, and she was swallowed by the ocean of screaming women and children that spread in all directions.${prompt}
After the battle had died down, I attempted to return to the city to find my dear friend, but I was stopped by the others.${prompt}
Since then, not a day has gone by that I haven't seen her in my dreams...calling out my name...
And that is why every year around this time I take this hairpin of hers to the Altar of the Dawn and pray... Pray that she can forgive me for the pain I caused her...${prompt}
Before I go to the altar, may I ask you one more favor?${prompt}
Would you find Pradiulot and tell him that I will be waiting for him by the well?${prompt}
Have you found Pradiulot and told him that I will be waiting for him by the well?${prompt}
Ah, the adventurer from the mainland. May I help you?${prompt}
Elysia is waiting for me by the well? Whatever could be wrong...?${prompt}
I'm sorry that I asked you to do that.${prompt}
It is just that I don't want him to see me when I make the offering for Mischanau.${prompt}
I haven't been completely honest with you.${prompt}
However, because of the injury he sustained during the war, he no longer remembers anything about her.${prompt}
Mischanau was my best friend, and I was elated when I heard the news of her marriage.${prompt}
Even if the groom was my childhood friend...and sweetheart...
I truly did wish them eternal happiness from the bottom of my heart.${prompt}
But maybe there was a part of my heart that secretly despised my friend for stealing Pradiulot away from me... And maybe that is why I let go of her twenty years ago...${prompt}
I could not live with this sin bearing down upon my soul...${prompt}
So, when the injured Pradiulot woke from his coma, I told him everything that happened. However, by then it was too late. He no longer remembered me--or his late wife.${prompt}
I do not know what will become of Pradiulot's memory in the future, but until he has fully recovered, I have chosen to stand by his side.${prompt}
This, I feel, is the only way I can pay for my terrible sins...${prompt}
Thank you again for all that you have done for me. I do not know how I can repay you.${prompt}
I must leave before Pradiulot returns. Please take this as a token of my gratitude.${prompt}
I hope that it can aid you in your future travels.${prompt}
Elysia was not at the well.${prompt}
What? She came by to say that she did not need to see me at all?${prompt}
Sometimes I just cannot understand that woman...
If you see her again, tell her that tonight's stew had better be sublime if she wishes I forgive her!${prompt}
Well, I guess I had better start working on that stew!${prompt}
Greetings, adventurer. Did you speak with Elysia again?
Excellent. Now I have something to look forward to when I am relieved of duty.${prompt}
If you do not mind me asking, what did you speak of with her?${prompt}
Elysia is a kind, kind woman.
When I was on my deathbed, she stayed by my side for three whole days and three whole nights, tending to my wounds until I recovered from my coma.${prompt}
Her heart is as pure as the clear waters of Cascade Edellaine.${prompt}
I have never met a woman so gentle and so sincere...${prompt}
And perhaps that is her only fault...${prompt}
Let me tell you a story.${prompt}
Long ago, there was a boy who had a wonderful treasure so important to him that he always kept it by his side.${prompt}
The treasure was so dear to him that one day, when he had to go on a long journey, he felt the only person he could trust with that treasure was his best friend.${prompt}
However, while the boy was away, a terrible accident occurred and the treasure was lost forever.${prompt}
When the boy returned and found what had happened to his treasure, he hated his friend for not being able to protect the item.
But deep inside, the boy knew that the loss of his treasure was not only the fault of his friend.${prompt}
He knew that he, too, was responsible...${prompt}
However, as long as the loss of the treasure remained in the boy's heart, he knew that his friend would forever suffer with the pain of not fulfilling his promise.${prompt}
The boy did not wish this of his longtime companion.${prompt}
And so he chose to lose his memory.${prompt}
This may sound ridiculous, but to the boy this was the only way to ease the suffering of his friend, as well as his own.${prompt}
By choosing to forget about the past, it could no longer hurt him or his friend.${prompt}
And so he lived in happiness, until the day he died...${prompt}
Ah, I apologize for my babbling.${prompt}
Farewell, traveler. I hope that you, too, can find joy in this world filled with sorrow.${prompt}
You must have had a long, tiring journey.
I'm sorry our town doesn't have that much to offer...${prompt}
The ships from Jeuno bring in all sorts of produce and spices. My kitchen shelves will never be bare again!${prompt}
Day in and day out, it is always “all clear”...
However, I guess I cannot complain...${prompt}
Lately there has been an increase in the number of outsiders utilizing our safehold's facilities. More ruffians means more crime...and that is what I am here to prevent.${prompt}
I'm a traveling moogle, kupo. I help adventurers in the Outlands access items they have stored in a Mog House elsewhere, kupo.${prompt}
This isn't a Mog House, so you can only use the “Mog Safe,” “Change Jobs,” and “Delivery Box” commands, kupo.${prompt}
You have to pay fee of ${number: 0} gil to transfer your items to the Outlands, kupo. Why? Because the world is a cold place for rogue moogles, kupo.${prompt}

Of course, you can move your items back to your Mog House in town, but if you want to transfer them to the Outlands again, you'll have to pay another fee, kupo. I've got to make a living too, kupo.${prompt}
You don't have enough gil, kupo.${prompt}
Please have a look at these fine Tavnazian-built products!${prompt}
I'll sell you what I've got if you fork over enough dough!${prompt}
Do you need any Tavnazian produce?
We don't have much, but find a fine cook and your problems will be solved!${prompt}
Do you need any Tavnazian produce?
Since the arrival of the aid from Jeuno, our inventory has almost doubled!${prompt}
I'm sorry that we don't have more to offer, but...${prompt}
Thanks to the supplies from Jeuno, I've been able to fix some of the weapons I had in storage!${prompt}
As much as we'd like to sell you all the equipment we have in our warehouses, there is just not enough...${prompt}
With the arrival of supplies from Jeuno, we are now able to sell some of the items we had stored in these warehouses.${prompt}
I may have a few things that could be of interest.${prompt}
I've been given authorization to begin the sale of the old Tavnazian armor we had in storage!${prompt}
Would you buy something from my humble shop? I have five children to feed...${prompt}
Even with the aid from Jeuno, I still have trouble feeding my six children...${prompt}
The safehold warehouses used to store a great amount of equipment and supplies. However, now the rooms are almost completely bare...${prompt}
I have been assigned to watch over the supplies in these storage rooms, though there is little to watch over...${prompt}
If we could only make contact with the mainland...
Then, maybe, the day would come when these warehouses are filled with goods from all over Vana'diel.${prompt}
My job is to keep inventory of these items.
However, I have to count really, really slow or I finish in ten minutes!${prompt}
My legs may be short, but they're faster than lightning!
I guarantee I'll get your goods to where you want them to be!${prompt}
The one thing Tavnazia does have a lot of, though, is storage space! <Sigh>${prompt}
I can send your items to anywhere in Vana'diel!${prompt}

Do you find our enclosed city strange? That is probably because it is so different from what you have seen on the mainland.${prompt}
However, for us--the forgotten--this city is all we know and all we have.${prompt}
Safehold elder Despachiaire has welcomed that envoy from Jeuno with open arms. However...${prompt}
I have a terrible feeling something grave is upon us. Even those three menacing Tarutaru are acting strange...${prompt}
A great challenge awaits you in the skies, ${name-player}.${prompt}
But I cannot help but think it ironic that a forgotten city such as ours would be the site of a battle that could alter the history of all Vana'diel.${prompt}
When I heard that somebody from the mainland had washed up on our island, I was expecting to see a burly pirate or a battle-scarred adventurer.${prompt}

But look at you. I've seen scarier things under my bed. The world must be pretty peaceful if a pansy like you can travel about Vana'diel without getting ${choice-player-gender}[his/her] head lopped off with an Orcish axe.${prompt}
Don't tell this to anybody, but I don't think I like that blonde robed guy with the funny apparatus over his eye.${prompt}
He has all the elders wrapped around his little finger, but something tells me he's trying to pull a fast one.${prompt}
If you even think of doing anything to make Prishe upset, I'll personally whack you upside the head so hard you won't remember what you had for breakfast.${prompt}
Yeah, she may be a little rough around the edges, but deep inside she's only thinking of her friends and family here in the safehold.${prompt}
It looks like something big's brewing...${prompt}
I've never been too good with words, but...${prompt}
Get out there and do what you have to do. For the safehold's sake, for Prishe's sake...heck, for the world's sake!${prompt}
Maybe it's because we've lived in solitude for so long, but a lot of us have a hard time opening up to those from the outside.${prompt}
But since you came, things have started to change.
You'd better have a look around the safehold while you can, because when our boss gets back, you might not be left with any legs to stand on.${prompt}
No, I'm not talking about Justinius.
Sure, he's the captain of the Tavnazian Patrol, but all final calls are made by the boss.${prompt}
Still standing, I see. I thought Prishe would have whipped you into a pile of crimson jelly by now.${prompt}
I don't know what the boss sees in you, but I'm not one to question her judgment.${prompt}
The safehold elder has been calling Prishe “the abhorrent one” since I was knee-high to a bugard's eye.${prompt}
I never actually knew what he was trying to say...${prompt}
Come to think of it, I don't even know what “abhorrent” means!${prompt}
You're going to save the boss, right!?${prompt}
I didn't think much of you before, and to tell you the truth, I don't think much of you now. But there is one thing I do know, and that is if anybody can help Prishe, it's you!${prompt}
I knew you could do it! I never doubted you for a minute!
Hey, why don't you join the Tavnazian Patrol? I'd be honored to have a fine ${choice-player-gender}[man/woman] like you working under me.${prompt}
Hm? You're not done with your journey yet?
You adventurers have it hard, don't you?${prompt}
There is a young girl living here who the elders all refer to as “the abhorrent one.”${prompt}
Oh, do not worry. You will know her when you see her.${prompt}
Everyone in the safehold always follows what Prishe says. Am I the only one who feels that this is even the slightest bit odd?${prompt}
Sir Justinius is the captain of the Tavnazian Patrol. He should have authority over all affairs concerning the city.${prompt}
However, when it comes to making any sort of decision, all the men run off to that despicable little girl.${prompt}
Ah, please do not tell anyone what I just told you.
If Tressia or Mengrenaux were to find out, my rations would be cut in half for a week...${prompt}
You see, I told you Prishe was a terrible child.${prompt}
I can assure you that there will be more problems to come as long as she remains in the safehold!${prompt}
I knew that Prishe would bring misfortune to our peaceful city...${prompt}
However, I have a feeling that you and our lea--and that dastardly child will be victorious in your efforts.${prompt}
Of course I despise her, but I cannot deny that she is the strongest woman I have ever met.${prompt}
Prishe survived the battle, did she not!?
Me, worry about “the abhorrent one”? Do not be absurd...${prompt}
You probably wonder why we have chosen to live our lives under the ground in these caves.${prompt}
The roads leading to the old Marquisate capital have sunk to the bottom of the seas, and the surrounding meadows crawl with terrible beasts and remnants of the beastman armies.${prompt}
It is amazing that our tiny patrol is even able to maintain the peace in this small corner of the island...${prompt}
The sudden influx of visitors from Jeuno has left many of the safehold residents scared and confused. However, I welcome their presence as a blessing.${prompt}
I do not wish to be tied to this cursed place for the rest of my life...${prompt}
So you plan to wage a war against the Wyrmking and his minions?
I apologize, but I fear the Tavnazian Patrol does not possess the manpower to assist you this time.${prompt}
However, in your absence we shall ensure the safety of the remaining safehold residents.
Welcome home! We are all relieved to see you made it back unharmed.${prompt}
How was your ride on the airship? I had heard stories of the flying machines, but I never thought I would have the opportunity to see one up close.${prompt}
Perhaps some day I will be blessed with the opportunity to ride one as well...${prompt}
That door over there leads to the safehold elder Despachiaire's quarters.${prompt}
Even now, elder Despachiaire believes that someday Cardinal Mildaurion will return to Tavnazia.${prompt}
The great cardinal who led our fathers out of the flames of despair to this refuge...
To us that were born after the Great War, stories of her are as distant as fairy tales.${prompt}
After years of following the words of the cardinal, how can the elder believe the utterings of a complete stranger?${prompt}
Or maybe he has simply resorted to grasping at any thread of hope, no matter how thin...${prompt}
Since Ulmia's departure, Despachiaire has not once left his quarters.${prompt}
I believe I now know why he was so quick to trust that Nag'molada.${prompt}
All he wanted to do was protect his granddaughter and the people of the safehold from suffering any more than they already had...${prompt}
This is the main entrance to the Tavnazian Safehold.${prompt}
This is Prishe and Ulmia's room.${prompt}
I'd keep your distance if you know what's good for you.${prompt}
It's been kind of lonely without Ulmia or the boss around.${prompt}
I sure hope nothing happens to Ulmia...${prompt}
Oh, I know nothing will happen to Prishe. There isn't a jam she hasn't been able to find her way out of!${prompt}
You see? I told you Prishe would be fine.${prompt}
But I'd suggest putting your adventures on hold for a while. We wouldn't want to make elder Despachiaire too upset...${prompt}
Just when I thought they were back for good, Ulmia and Prishe have run off again.${prompt}
I wonder if they'll ever be back...${prompt}
You're on your way to fight the wyrms, aren't you?
I really wish that Ulmia would reconsider going...${prompt}
...but she wouldn't listen to me, would she...${prompt}
Beyond those doors lie the Phomiuna Aqueducts.${prompt}
The Phomiuna Aqueducts are connected in many places to the Tavnazian Cathedral's Sacrarium.${prompt}
However, during the Great War many of the hallways caved in, making them virtually impassable.${prompt}
In addition to that, Cardinal Mildaurion placed a powerful seal on the areas to weaken any beasts that remained in the halls and chambers.${prompt}
She sacrificed her life to help the survivors of the burning city. We owe more than our lives to her...${prompt}
This cave leads to the Sealion's Den.${prompt}
The cave was once used as a private port for the Tavnazian Cathedral, but now...${prompt}
Recently, with all the supply ships from Jeuno coming and going, the port has been very active.${prompt}
The nation of Jeuno has offered its hand to help lift up the ailing Tavnazia.${prompt}
None of this would have been possible were it not for the kindness of Sir Nag'molada.${prompt}
I deeply regret never telling my granddaughter not to fraternize with that abhorrent Prishe.${prompt}
I can no longer allow Ulmia to be near those who are only out to deceive her.${prompt}
Even if that happened to include an outsider such as you...${prompt}
Is Ulmia... Is my granddaughter well?${prompt}
I beg of you, do not let anything harm her.${prompt}
I have given up trying to hold Ulmia back.${prompt}
She has the right to see the world for what it is, and find the destiny that awaits her.${prompt}
I now realize that my duty as a grandfather is not to control her, but to watch over her as she walks her own path.${prompt}
Young folk these days have become blind to the light of Altana.${prompt}
They do not realize it is her blessing that fills this well with water for us to drink...${prompt}
May Altana have mercy on their pitiful souls!${prompt}
As much as we'd like to rebuild the capital city of Tavnazia, I don't see it happening any time in the near future.${prompt}
That place is crawling with remnants of the beastman army, all of them thirsty for the enemy's fresh blood...${prompt}
The Tavnazian and San d'Orian Cathedrals both have roots in the same faith that originated centuries ago in the Elvaan kingdom.${prompt}

However, under the guidance of Cardinal Mildaurion C Giloumet, the Tavnazian Cathedral eventually branched from the original teachings of the San d'Orian church and began to evolve separately.${prompt}
Unfortunately, the Great War put an end to any further development of the Marquisate's culture...${prompt}
Now that Jeuno has reinstated ties with Tavnazia, it's only a matter of time before talks with the San d'Orian Cathedral are held.${prompt}
But I wonder if San d'Oria will really offer to help us...${prompt}
The Phomiuna Aqueducts that connect the safehold with the capital city of Tavnazia are a haven for monsters that feed on the flesh of unprepared travelers.${prompt}
However, thanks to a powerful seal the cardinal placed on the area twenty years ago, the power of the beasts is kept to a minimum.${prompt}
Unfortunately, the seal also affects anyone else who journeys into the tunnels...${prompt}
It is because of this that I often fear for the safety of my children and grandchildren...${prompt}
I can only pray that Altana has mercy on those Tavnazians with pure souls...${prompt}
...and strikes down those who bring disaster to our humble city.${prompt}
This super-spiffy safe-hold used to be filled with lots of se-cret rooms and hid-den sup-plies.${prompt}
But now there's hard-ly a-ny-thing left in this place, not coun-ting dust and cree-py-craw-ly cock-roa-ches, of course.${prompt}
I e-ven heard that a long, long, long, long time a-go, the Tav-na-zian Ca-the-dral re-ceived a bunch of mur-der-ous-ly mys-ter-i-ous re-lics from the San d'Or-i-an Ca-the-dral.${prompt}
But un-less it's something tip-pity-top tas-ty to munch on, I'm not that in-ter-rest-ed in any mus-ty old an-tiques.${prompt}
I have heard stories from passing adventurers claiming all royal members of the Marquisate were killed during the Great War.${prompt}
If this is true, then perhaps there is no hope for the future of the Pearl of Zafmlug.${prompt}
Why do you take so much, while in return only give so little!?${prompt}
I washed up on the southern beaches of this island nearly seven years ago when my ship was destroyed in a terrible storm.${prompt}
If it were not for the kindness of the people living here, I most surely would have met the same fate as my crewmates...${prompt}
Walk through this here cave, and you'll find the headquarters of the Tavnazian Patrol. Travel a little bit further in, and you'll come by Prishe and Ulmia's quarters.${prompt}
On the other side of this passageway lies elder Despachiaire's private quarters, as well as the safehold well.${prompt}
Back through here you'll find a couple of shops and a whole bunch of cutesy-wootsey, fuzzy-wuzzy moogles!${prompt}
Through this cave you'll find a number of storage rooms and warehouses, but most all of them are nearly empty...${prompt}
We've transformed the once empty warehouses into auction houses and storage for delivery services.
Have the days of glory finally returned to Tavnazia?${prompt}
I can smell the dark blood of the undead as it drips slowly from your soiled garments.${prompt}
Beware, my friend, for you are not alone in your journey. Lost spirits lurk in the shadows behind you, waiting for their chance to rob you of your soul.${prompt}
You still have a fairly good head start, but they will not let up until they have found you and filled your heart with poison and pain.${prompt}
They are close... It is only a matter of time before you have fallen within their reach.${prompt}
Can you not feel the hands that reach up from the bottomless depths of hell? Can you not feel the gaze of a thousand eyes, glowing red with anger and hate?${prompt}
The grip of evil is tightening on the very essence of what makes you who you are.
Be forewarned, as it will not be long before you are confronted with a battle for more than just your life.${prompt}
May the light of the Dawn Goddess lead you from the pitch-black depths of darkness!${prompt}
All the adults say it's too dangerous to go outside and play on the coast, but I'm sick of spending all day locked up in this cave.${prompt}
Yeah, I wish we could go out adventuring like the Chebukkis!${prompt}
Hey! Kukki said that he was going to give that to me!
I wish I was older so I could help my mom...${prompt}
Since Dad died, she's been so busy...${prompt}
Cherukiki brought my mom a whole barrelful of supplies from the mainland.${prompt}
She said she was happy, but I saw her crying.
I don't understand adults at all...${prompt}
I feel sorry for the children all cooped up here in the safehold, but it is just too dangerous to allow them to play outside.${prompt}
I will not say who, but there are three troublemakers who have taken it upon themselves to ignore this rule.${prompt}
After returning from Jeuno, those troublesome Tarutaru personally delivered a barrel of supplies to my quarters.${prompt}
Maybe I was wrong about them...${prompt}
The other day, those three Tarutaru presented me with the charred remains of some awful beast and told me to try it because it was “mighty tasty.”${prompt}
Since they were children, I had always told the Chebukki brothers to never shun from a challenge, but to think I would be tested by my own words...${prompt}
Did I show you what Makki brought me back from Jeuno? They are some of the most amazing things I have ever seen.${prompt}
One of them was a rare item made in the Far East, but I decided to give it to Yasuji.
He said that he used to live in the Eastern empire before his ship wrecked...${prompt}
I tell ya, all these here young folk in the safehold ain't never had it hard--'specially those dangnabbed Tarutots!${prompt}
Why, back in my day, we had to fight through herds of wild bugards and Orc armies in the snow--with nothin' more than our bare fists--just to make it to the outhouse!${prompt}
Well, whaddaya know. Somebody went an' done taught those darn tootin' Tarutots some manners.${prompt}
Why, they even brought me a brand-spankin'-new pair of extra fancy wooden teeth from that Jeuno place they moseyed off to.${prompt}
Well, we can ass-ume from the name that it's some-thing that was kept in the mar-qui-sate.${prompt}
Un-for-tu-nate-ly, I can't tell you much more.
May-be some-bo-dy who used to work at the ca-the-dral knows some-thing.${prompt}
Young traveler, you don't believe that there is some great treasure hidden in the Sacrarium, do you?${prompt}
Well, I hate to be the one who has to tell you this, but there's nothing but old rubbish left in that place--its rooms were raided and plundered years ago.${prompt}
The arrival of that Elvaan knight reminded me of a story my teacher used to tell us at grammar school.${prompt}

Long ago, there was a frighteningly powerful jewel hidden somewhere in the Marquisate, and to protect us from its evil, Cardinal Mildaurion had placed a powerful seal upon it. I wonder if that tale was true...${prompt}
Before the Marquisate of Tavnazia was destroyed, the region was a thriving center for commerce. Ships from all across Vana'diel would grace our nation's ports.${prompt}
However, the most prominent were those from the nations of the West.
I remember one time a Western vessel carrying a mountain of gold ingots arrived in Tavnazia offering to purchase a jewel known as the “something-or-other of Tavnazia.”${prompt}
My late brother was once a member of the Tavnazian choir.
I remember him once telling me that there existed a lost hymn that not a single member of the Tavnazian Cathedral was able to sing.${prompt}
He said it was the words from that hymn that would save the children of Altana from their lives of suffering.${prompt}
The elder Despachiaire's granddaughter has the most magnificent voice. It is as if you were hearing the whisper of the Dawn Goddess herself.${prompt}
However, I remember there being another young girl in the Tavnazian choir who was just as talented as Lady Ulmia.${prompt}
If only little Emeline had survived the beastman attack.${prompt}
Long, long ago, an ancient race, descended from the gods, flourished in Vana'diel.${prompt}
They traveled through the sky, extracted gold from stones, and gave birth to grasslands across the world.${prompt}
But one day, they decided to build a pathway to the divine entrance of Paradise.${prompt}
Enraged by such a brazen display of insolence, the gatekeeper destroyed their path and cast their homes to the bottom of the sea.
Shortly thereafter, the goddess Altana awakened and saw the ruin that had once been Vana'diel. Saddened, She wept five divine tears.${prompt}
When the five tears fell upon the earth, they gave life to the five races of Vana'diel.
But the god Promathia saw this from His place in the shadows. The Twilight God saw fit to condemn Altana's work, cursing the people with eternal conflict amongst themselves.${prompt}
He created terrible beasts and spread them across the world, commanding them to fight the people of Vana'diel and occupy their minds.${prompt}
Never again would they think to open the Gate of the Gods.${prompt}
This is the entrance to the Tavnazian Safehold.${prompt}
Twenty years ago, we were all overjoyed when news of the allied forces' victory over the Shadow Lord's armies finally reached our island.${prompt}
However, deep inside we knew that this would only be a short-lived triumph. As long as there is light in the world, there will always exist darkness.${prompt}
For the past twenty years, not a day has gone by when the words of Cardinal Mildaurion haven't rung in my mind.${prompt}
The tales of the beastmen and their devilish plan to bring their terrible god back to life, eradicating Vana'diel of mankind's seeds.${prompt}
Sometimes at night, I still see visions of the battlefield I stood on twenty years ago.
The cold eyes of the Kindred as they searched the landscape for their next victim...${prompt}
I remember hearing tales of how the Shadow Lord called up these bloodthirsty beasts from the depths of hell, where their dark leader awaited in slumber...${prompt}
Only in a p-place like this c-can a m-m-m-man like m-m-m-me hide from the ridicule of the w-world.${prompt}
Pay n-no heed t-to m-m-m-y ramblings...${prompt}
I thought that in a p-place like this, I m-m-m-might be able to hide from the r-ridicule of the w-world. However, n-now that Tavnazia has reopened its doors to the outside...${prompt}
I never really needed a mannequin to remind me how beautiful my Alsha was...is.${prompt}
That's right. From now on, she'll be here, right by my side...${prompt}
Are you trying to tell me you have lost...?${prompt}
Here. You must learn to cherish them with all you heart.${prompt}
Hail the proud and valiant knights of Tavnazia!
Raise the pennants and cheer us on to victory!${prompt}
You seek a young maiden and her airborne, alabaster companion?${prompt}
Why, the lady in question passed my trial and joined our illustrious order, just as you did!${prompt}
Why, the lady in question passed my trial and joined the Tavnazian order of knights!${prompt}
The fiery young damsel is on a quest to find the famous Goldmane!${prompt}
Thus I imparted to her the location of the bounty hunter's birthplace!${prompt}
He was raised in a shepherd's village found in the west of the Tavnazian archipelago.${prompt}
That land is now the site of tremendous change brought about by fell sorcery!${prompt}
Goldmane was born in that quiet village, but was loath to follow the shepherd's path.
After moving to Tavnazia, he took up the mercenary trade of the bounty hunter!${prompt}
When he met and married a lady mage, however, Goldmane's footsteps led him back to the place of his birth to start a family.${prompt}
People will always find their way back to the beginning.
The same holds true when we reach the end of our path in life.${prompt}
Yes, I once was a merchant selling Tavnazian crafts to the San d'Orian Cathedral.
I suppose you wonder how a mere merchant rose to the position of safehold elder.${prompt}
The answer is simple, young ${choice-player-gender}[man/woman]. I have merely outlived all those more qualified.${prompt}
However, do not be mistaken. Not once did I ask to be granted this position, and not once have I used it for any sort of personal gain.${prompt}
I apologize. I seem to have diverged from the matter at hand. Forget what you have heard... Just as I have forgotten the countless tribulations of my past...${prompt}
Yes. You wished to inquire about Tavnazian cuisine.
I suggest you speak with Jonette. She can be found with her daughter, down near the underground tributary.${prompt}
Jonette is well known throughout the safehold for her undying interest in Tavnazian dishes. She will more than likely be able to answer any questions you may have on the subject.${prompt}
Ah, you wouldn't happen to be an adventurer, would you? I usually avoid pestering others with my problems, but I find myself in a fix.${prompt}
Recently, I have begun studying traditional Tavnazian cooking methods.${prompt}
However, our libraries contain no books on the subject, and the mists of time have clouded the memories of the safehold elders.${prompt}

Our current state of affairs limits the bounty that we can bring to our children's plates. That is why I felt that rekindling the culinary arts of Tavnazia's past would rejuvenate the spirits of this cave's weary souls.${prompt}
You wouldn't have happened to come across anything on your journey that may be of use, would you?${prompt}
If you were to find something, I would be so grateful...as would all the other safehold residents.${prompt}
This is exactly the information I have been searching for!${prompt}
Your kindness is a blessing that will bring smiles to the dinner tables of Tavnazia.${prompt}
I know it is not much, but please accept this as a token of my appreciation.${prompt}
The information you have brought me on Tavnazian cuisine has been a wonderful help!${prompt}
If you happen to find any more, the children would be so delighted.${prompt}
Your fate rides on the changing winds of Vana'diel.
I can give you insight on the local weather.${prompt}

Hello, ${choice-player-gender}[sir/ma'am]. Have you ever found yourself throwing away items because your Mog Safe is overflowing with dusty sets of armor collected on your many adventures? My colleagues and I have heard the cries of our fellow adventurers and joined together to aid all those in need.${prompt}
Trade me a full set, and for a small fee (payable on pickup) we will hold on to it, all the while protecting it from thieves, moths, and any/all acts of god and/or goddess.${prompt}
Please be forewarned that we cannot store any high-quality equipment, and that the signatures on any pieces of collected armor will be lost.${prompt}
How may I be of service today?${prompt}

Do you wish to pay the fee?
I am sorry, ${choice-player-gender}[sir/ma'am]. ${number: 5} gil is required before we can return your armor.${prompt}
When you wish to have your armor returned, remember to present this claim slip along with the ${number: 5}-gil storage fee at any of our five convenient pickup locations around Vana'diel.${prompt}
Regulations do not allow adventurers to store more than one set of the same armor.${prompt}
The items you attempted to trade have been returned.${prompt}
If I could have a moment of your time...${prompt}
Eh? Why of course, Chemioue. But as you can see, I am quite busy at the moment. Perhaps we could speak a little while later.${prompt}
And of how many hours might “a little while” construe?${prompt}
I am going to need a little more time to come to a specific number...${prompt}
How long have you been standing there?${prompt}

You must know that it is quite impolite to eavesdrop on a lady's private conversation! Why, now that I think of it, there is only one other person who would do something so atrocious... Prishe!${prompt}
You know of whom I speak. Recently, a day does not go by without the other safehold residents reveling over that hooligan's every action.${prompt}
“Prishe repaired my subligar,” “Prishe dueled an Orcish Serjeant,” “Prishe saved my baby from a Megalobugard”... Prishe, Prishe, Prishe, Prishe, Prishe!${prompt}
If I hear that name one more time, I am going to scream so loud, the Mithra in Kazham will have to cover their ears to prevent them from exploding!${prompt}
Do not mistake me. I know full well what that ruffian is capable of accomplishing.${prompt}
It is how she goes about making those accomplishments. “Subtle” is a word that was unfortunately torn from her dictionary the day she was born.${prompt}
And what of Justinius? Our fearless leader ignores him like a chamber pot in the closet, leaving him to rot in the belly of this cave while she is off frolicking in the meadows!${prompt}
Who does she think she is!? Just because she had some terrible accident when she was a child does not give her the right to strut about the archipelago like she was the marquise!${prompt}
Unfortunately, most people, including poor Justinius, are blind to the truth--that she is nothing more than a selfish little brat with a mouth filthier than the backside of my boot!${prompt}
You agree with me, do you not? Or have you been brainwashed like all the others--the wool pulled over your very sense of reasoning?${prompt}
Do you truly believe that brute force and raw ambition will lead us to Paradise?${prompt}
Well, I certainly cannot. You will not witness me become a victim of that fiend's attempts at subjugation!${prompt}
You're not preaching about Prishe to this outsider, are you?${prompt}
Tr-Tressia! How long have you been standing there?${prompt}
How long? Have you seen me standing anywhere else?${prompt}
Chemioue, when are you going to put aside your feelings about Prishe and start concentrating on your duties?${prompt}
Aren't you supposed to be on your rounds? Or were you so busy talking to this adventurer that you forgot?${prompt}
When are you going to grow up and stop letting your emotions get in the way of things?${prompt}
Wait one moment! You are the last person to tell someone they need to grow up! Why, just last week I remember you holding Mengrenaux in a headlock because he would not lend you his buckler.${prompt}
That has nothing to do with anything! We're talking about you and Prishe here, Chemioue. Stop trying to change the subject!${prompt}
Change the subject? Were it not for your meddling, there would be no subject of which to speak!${prompt}
My opinions are merely a reflection of the discontent that dwells deep within the hearts of all Tavnazians.${prompt}
Not once have my feelings for that blue-haired sea worm ever impaired my judgment! Never!${prompt}
Are you suggesting I speak not the truth?${prompt}
I could care less if you swore on Eonnite's Revelations. That's not the point.${prompt}
The point is, unlike sniffling little children, adults know when to keep their opinions to themselves.${prompt}
I hope that she knows that I'm only saying these things because I want to help her.${prompt}
You see, when she was thirteen, Chemioue lost her older brother to an overgrown rose. Ever since then, she's turned to Justinius to fill the void in her heart left by her brother's death.${prompt}
Chemioue feels anger towards Prishe only because she's trying to protect Justinius.${prompt}
I just wish there was someone who could convince Chemioue of her faults before she does something drastic.${prompt}
If that Parelbriaux were only a little more reliable...${prompt}
Oh, Parelbriaux! Why does Tressia always have to side with that wench!?${prompt}
Calm down, Chemioue. While you may have your differences, you should not speak that way of your friend.${prompt}

I'm still in the beginning stages of my research, but I've already discovered a way to manipulate Xenomatter in a way that it can be used to multiply the strength and durability of certain materials. I hope that my further studies will result in the discovery of even more benefits.

For example, say I was to attempt to alter the polymolecular makeup of this clam using the Xenomatter in question. As you know, this particular variety of clam only lives in the shallows of a certain tiny island far off the coast of southeastern Mindartia.

To find one of these specimens, not only would one have to be an expert on the clam's native habitat, but also be knowledgeable of their mating and feeding patterns, their reactions to the rise and fall of geothermal temperature levels, as well as their migratory tendencies, and how all these are affected by the varying seasonal lunar cycles. After sealing the box with a cermopolymer compound (to prevent unnecessary carbo-oxidization), it is only a matter of minutes before a micronucleic reaction occurs and a minute quantity of fluoroplasm is released.${prompt}

I have come to the conclusion that the energy for this reaction comes from the calcitron particles concealed within the mucocide membranes located between the abdominal region of the clam and its shell. Overall, while I realize that the impact the excessive gathering of new specimens may have on the island's aquaculture could be catastrophic, I am ultimately left with no other option. Who am I to turn my back on scientific progress?${prompt}

Now as I was saying, when applied to the clams, the Xenomatter causes a photomutegenic reaction that eventually reduces the specimen to a pile of neutrinogen-rich ashes (those ashes tend to be alkaline-based; however, I have yet to determine the significance of this phenomenon).

If I can find the reason behind the aminofluid loss and its relation with the plasmatic release, I may be able to explain the finite relation of the clams' hydroplasma-oriented biomorphic structure to the quasizymotic nature of Xenomatter.
