Humes and Galka have never been the best of friends. I used to think that was just the way it was, and always would be.${prompt}
I figured I'd be causing myself grrrief if I stuck my whiskers into other nations' problems. My next catnap was all that mattered to me in those days. Ignorrrance is bliss, as they say.${prompt}

Responsibility for Raogrimm's trrransformation lies with all of us who traveled with him on that expedition. By sharing the blame for the crimes he committed as the Shadow Lord, we can finally call ourselves his trrrue companions.${prompt}
Let me help you on your path. May guiding light fill this ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}!
Raogrimm's fate is in your hands.
There is a broken branch thrust into the ground here.${prompt}
There is a symbol carved into the rock here.${prompt}
I have been waiting for you.${prompt}
Do you remember the last words Raogrimm spoke to you? "The link will soon be severed"...
Do you understand the significance of these words?${prompt}
When the soul that was divided is whole once again, towering rage will take on physical form...
Yes, a new Shadow Lord will be born. Even I will no longer hear his voice.${prompt}
Even now, I can barely feel the emanations of Raogrimm's faltering spirit. When those emanations fade completely, he will be...${prompt}

The Xarcabard of that other realm is shrouded in a vast darkness, preventing contact from the outside. Even those of us without material bodies are unable to penetrate that mist of eternal night.${prompt}
Until that mist clears, I cannot guide you to Xarcabard.
The next place you must venture is the twin of Vana'diel's Beaucedine. There you will find the last trophy to complete the set of keys we need.${prompt}
You must obtain the last trophy.
All five trophies combined with our power will create a synergistic force, allowing us to part the shroud for a few precious moments. It will open a path between worlds.${prompt}
May the blessings of Altana guide and protect you...
Even after the blackest night, the golden sun always rises to begin a new morning.
This troubled land will soon have its dawn...of that I am certain.${prompt}
I never thought to walk this land again, not even in death.
Is this what they call karma...?${prompt}
This land has borne the weight of my sins.
I will not beg for forgiveness, but accept my responsibility...${prompt}
So this is the reason for that unspeakable terror I feltaru here when I was still alive. It's possible that the other realm has existed for much longer than anyone ever dreamed...
I'm not rrreally fond of touching platitudes.
Snap Raogrimm to his senses with a big ol' smack to the head for me.${prompt}
Put an end to this thirty-year nightmare, ${name-player}.
${lettercase: 1}${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}! Show us the path to Xarcabard!
Death does not exist in that realm. You might call it a “prison of souls.”${prompt}
Even those who fall in battle will rise again after a time as if nothing had happened.
Like a flame returning to a candle whose light has been extinguished...${prompt}
It is an endless succession of life and death. How many times has that cycle repeated itself in that damned abode?${prompt}

There is one thing that bothers me. Whatever happened to the original wielders of the weapons and armor that the beastmen there now possess? If the statues in the shape of Orcs and such were once actual beastmen, then...? But I get carried away with my musings.${prompt}
Please pay no mind to my ramblings.
You have secured the ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}. An incredible feat. It proves the strength of your conviction, and is one of the keys you will need to enter Xarcabard.${prompt}
You will need four such trophies.
Once you have them within your grasp, make your way to Beaucedine Glacier in the Northlands. Cornelia awaits you there.${prompt}
I don't know about the other four, but I can't hear his voice anymore...${prompt}
Is this another brand I must bear for my treachery? I must truly be hated if that's the case.${prompt}
It is something I would wish for at the moment, however. I pray this silence is just a continuation of our incompatible personalities.
If not, then it means his pronouncement has become reality...${prompt}
This is more than just a testament to your strength. It is one of the keys that will lead you to Xarcabard, along with the trophies of the other realms.${prompt}
When you have all four trophies, travel to Beaucedine Glacier in the Northlands. You will find Cornelia waiting for you there.
That is all the wisdom I have left to give you.${prompt}
What is the true nature of that other world? I can only explain it as a place that lies beyond the limitarus of our knowledge.
But I'm sure I've feltaru that aura somewhere before...${prompt}

That's it. That protocrystal I came across when I was doing research in Elshimo. The magical emanations coming from the crystal gave me a similar impression. An avatar? No, that can'taru be...${prompt}
I appear to have driftarued into my old habits.${prompt}

This ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} is both a symbol of your fortitude, and one of the keys that will help you gain access to Xarcabard. The trophies from the other three realms carry the same importance.${prompt}

Gather all four trophies and hurry yourself on to Beaucedine Glacier. Cornelia will be waiting for you when you get there. But be wary, ${name-player}. The blackness enveloping that world grows ever deeper, ever darker...${prompt}
The beastmen of that world carry the spoils of prrrevious battles. Equipment that you or I would use.${prompt}
I'm not able to touch them in my prrresent form, but I feel something about those weapons and armor...something extrrraordinary.${prompt}
I don't mean that they're currrsed or anything like that! It's something more like, um, not ominous, but...
Anyway! They're not evil, just...you know? Different from other normal swords and things. Being all ghostlike and stuff, you can feel things like that.${prompt}
But enough of that kinda talk--congrrratulations are in order!
You've got your paws on the ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}! It shows you've got the goods in the hero department, and it will also help you get into Xarcabard.${prompt}
But first you've got to collect the other three trophies and then hightail it to snowy Beaucedine Glacier. Cornelia should be up there waiting for you.${prompt}
These artifacts have long been lost to that other world.
The Hydra Corps was a unit formed after our expedition to the Northlands.${prompt}
It must have been in the time of the Great War...
Nobody knows how the Hydra artifacts came to be there, but those five trophies will open the path for you.${prompt}
Each of these items holds a measure of power. However, the strength of a single artifact is limited.${prompt}
Combining these separate entities created a bridge from Vana'diel to the other realms.
Xarcabard, I'm afraid, is another matter entirely...${prompt}
Unless the shroud of darkness is lifted, that power alone will not be enough to open the way.
However, the five trophies resonate with another artifact that lies within his land. If we can join our strength to theirs...${prompt}
Let us make haste to the land where this all began. To Xarcabard...${prompt}
No, the rage has merely been dispersed.${prompt}
As long as I exist, he will never truly die...${prompt}
Or perhaps an eternal soul is something beyond the concept of death?${prompt}
You have achieved an incredible feat--the unification of the Shadow Lord has been prevented.
I have not the words to express my gratitude.${prompt}
The power of the crystal has faded, but I will be drawn into that towering rage no more.
I have heard the voice of the one who holds sway over this realm...${prompt}
Yes. From the center of infinite darkness.
I was in a place beyond comprehension when those words reached into my mind...${prompt}
You who have touched the crystal, the one who holds immortal power within a mortal shell.
The rage that has arisen from your twisted core will devour my world.${prompt}
It was an error in judgment to shelter you...
The order of my realm has been disrupted.${prompt}
I give to you a duty...
You will stand vigil until an age without hatred has dawned.${prompt}
No matter what terrible power you might wield, there is no escape from Dynamis for an incomplete soul.
No return to the land of blessed light...${prompt}
What manner of being was this who spoke from a pit of blackness?
As this question gnawed at my mind, the voice grew quiet, leaving me in unanswered silence.${prompt}
Of one thing I was certain.
This voice belonged to the ruler of Dynamis.${prompt}
A flow of energy exists in Vana'diel that has escaped the notice of those who dwell there.${prompt}
Thirty years past, my contact with the crystal caused an accelerated change in this flow.
It was as if it had leapt forward, rushing along a deliberate course.${prompt}
Nobody knows what lies at the end of this journey.
Perhaps it will reveal the true nature of Vana'diel.${prompt}
${name-player}, you may be the one to witness this truth.${prompt}
The power stored in the ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} will soon be drained.
And I must remain in this world in my role of observer.${prompt}
Do not forget who you are, ${name-player}.
I bid farewell to a most heroic adventurer.${prompt}
This duty is too much for just one to bear.
If you will have me, I will stand at your side until an age without hatred has arrived.
It pains me to see the depths to which my country has fallen.${prompt}
That is my only reason for staying. Do not misunderstand my motivations.${prompt}
Blessed light and the ruler of Dynamis?
I do believe you've rekindled my long-forgotten sense of adventure.${prompt}
Once I've gotten all firedy-up, even you can'taru keep me back, Raogrimm.
I'm sure my incomparable research skills will be of use in your task.${prompt}
C'mon, let's see a little excitement!
This is our expedition's thirty-year rrreunion.${prompt}
It's not the Northlands this time.
None of us are going to grow old and die, so who else would you want with you on a task as long as this one?${prompt}
I'm not gonna back down, no matterrr how much you complain.
Better just give in and accept the fact that you're stuck with me.${prompt}
I thought this would be the end of you for sure...
Hmph. You're just as thick-skinned as you used to be.${prompt}
What, no words for an old friend?
Thinking about testing your theory on whether or not a soul can be killed?${prompt}
I extinguished the light of your precious Cornelia!
The man responsible for this entire nightmare stands right before you!${prompt}
And there were things that came to an end...
Even though I was a prisoner of uncontrollable rage, the fact remains that I took the lives of my companions with my own hands.${prompt}
And yet, my old companions, you are the ones who have saved me from falling into that pit of hatred a second time.${prompt}
I have words of gratitude, but do not stand in a position to blame anyone for their actions.
No matter who that person may be.${prompt}
Are you sure you want to do this?
This duty will continue until hatred has faded from the land.
As long as my divided soul remains, there may never be an end to that rage...${prompt}
There is no need to suffer alone anymore.
Our presence here should answer your question.${prompt}
There are crimes that must be atoned for.
And if that means staying on after death and watching over this world, then we who were your companions will share the burden along with you.${prompt}
Until the dawn of an age without hatred...
No, as long as this world continues to be, I will remain by your side.${prompt}

The dreamer of this realm is a separate entity than he who dreamt of that wasteland of malice, Xarcabard. ${prompt}
Who would dare bring a new dream into my world of Dynamis?${prompt}
I divided my form in order to find the answer, but my counterpart has yet to return to me.${prompt}
While wandering through this realm, you may come across another semblance of myself.${prompt}
The memory of our encounter will become a guide to my shadow as it wanders this dream.${prompt}
Search for my counterpart, and unite this realm with your own dream.${prompt}
A nightmare curses this land yet again.${prompt}
I have been watching your dream.${prompt}
But you cannot grasp the identity of this realm's dreamer from there.
This land will continue to devour its way into Dynamis.${prompt}
You must find my counterpart and crush the dreamer of this realm.${prompt}
I see that you have gathered three slivers of black crystal...${prompt}
The Emptiness is sealed inside of them. Those are no mere fragments.${prompt}

Find and destroy the source if you wish to protect my realm.${prompt}

The shadow that you defeated had been consumed by the dreamer of this realm.${prompt}
It seems that this nightmare was dreamt into existence by beings who have come into contact with the Emptiness.${prompt}
It seems that this nightmare was dreamt into existence by beings who came into contact with the Emptiness.${prompt}

When I next see her, she will pay dearly.${prompt}
Could it have been that girl...?

Her malice will not perish as long as this dream continues, using my shadows to revive countless times.${prompt}
You must confront the nightmare and continue to fight them to keep this realm from spreading.${prompt}
The dreamer is not the girl who once harbored the Emptiness...
Could it have been transferred to another girl...?${prompt}
You know this girl well. I could take care of her easily, but if you wish me to spare her, then you will lend me your power.${prompt}

The synergy furnaces you see around town are provided as a public service by the Bastokan Institute of Synergy Research, to ensure that no synergist is ever far away from the tools of their trade.${prompt}
The synergist must provide his or her own ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}, as well as any materials to be used in the synergy process.
Provided those conditions are met, synergy furnaces may be used free of charge.${prompt}
Needless to say, only one party may operate any given furnace at once.${prompt}
Fortunately, there are multiple furnaces installed throughout town.
If the furnace before you is already in use, please seek out an unused one elsewhere, or wait patiently for your turn.${prompt}
You may think of synergy as an evolved form of synthesis.
It is a discipline full of heretofore unimagined possibilities, but one which demands consummate skill from its practitioners.${prompt}
Like synthesis, synergy involves combining materials according to a prescribed recipe to yield oft-spectacular results.
The rub is that each synergy recipe also dictates a certain elemental balance that must be achieved for the procedure to be successful.${prompt}
This balance is achieved through skillful infusion of combustible elemental crystals that we synergists call “fewell.”
To begin the synergy process, you'll have to feed the furnace with fewell and get those flames burning!${prompt}
As a general rule, the more complex the recipe, the more fewell it will require.
Take care to check your stock before you fire up the furnace, lest you find its flames guttering out at a crucial moment.${prompt}
With the belly of the furnace roaring up a storm, it's time to toss in your materials and start synergizing!

Keep a close eye on the balance of elements and deploy fewell as necessary. Approach the prescribed elemental balance, and your item will take form, allowing you to remove it from the furnace.${prompt}
The closer you are to the ideal elemental balance, the higher the quality of your finished product will be.
In synergy, it pays to be a perfectionist!${prompt}
But be forewarned: these furnaces can only sustain the elemental maelstrom swirling and storming inside them for so long.${prompt}
If the furnace's durability should fail, the synergy process will be interrupted, and you will be forced to start anew.${prompt}
Take heart, though, as any materials inside your ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} will remain intact.
You may retrieve them or attempt the synergy process again as you see fit.${prompt}
Any fewell consumed in the failed synergy attempt, on the other hand, will be permanently lost.${prompt}
Synergists must also be wary of debris buildup, an unavoidable side effect of the volatile elemental reactions that take place within the synergy furnace.${prompt}
Should too much debris be allowed to accumulate, the contents of the furnace will become unstable, potentially leading to unpleasant explosions and eruptions.
Such accidents pose considerable risk to the synergy attempt in progress, as well as the physical well-being of the synergist, so be sure to exercise due caution!${prompt}
You may be asking yourself, “Why, how in the name of Hildolf am I going to oversee all of these complicated procedures and variables by myself?”${prompt}
Here's the good news: you don't have to!
For you see, synergy furnaces are designed for use by multiple operators.${prompt}
The more complex the recipe, the greater level of skill and hands-on manipulation it will demand.
At such times, it would be in your best interest to seek out like-minded synergists and take on the challenge together.${prompt}
Finally, it would be remiss of me not to make mention of ${item-singular: 0[2]}, the curious substance whose properties are only now--with the emergence of synergy--becoming known to us.${prompt}
Though there is much yet to be learned, our research has revealed that ${item-singular: 0[2]} may be used to bolster your equipment, if attached in a proper manner.${prompt}
Mind you, ${item-singular: 0[2]} is not easy to come by, and I can offer no clues as to where or how to obtain it.
Should you be fortunate enough to come across some in your travels, however, I encourage you to explore its potential.${prompt}
Synergy is not a discipline for the faint of heart or mind, but with dedication and cooperation, there are great rewards to be reaped.
May your career as a synergist prove fruitful!${prompt}
First, you'll be wanting to check your fewell supply.
You may do so by speaking with a synergy engineer such as myself, or by examining a synergy furnace.${prompt}
You'll be needing at least one unit of fewell for each element dictated by your recipe.
Without this, even the most skilled synergist cannot hope to succeed.${prompt}
Should your fewell supply be in order, it's time to proceed with the synergy.
If you are using one of these public synergy furnaces here, you'll need to examine it and lay claim to its use.${prompt}
You may then deposit your ingredients. Should they correspond to a proper recipe, the synergy furnace will fire up automatically.
Note that as a safety precaution, the furnace will not activate if the recipe is beyond your level of synergy skill.${prompt}
From here, it becomes a race against the clock!
Through skilled operation of the synergy furnace, you must achieve the elemental balance prescribed by the recipe before the furnace's durability fails.${prompt}
Fortunately, synergy furnaces are outfitted with a wide array of features designed to aid the synergist in this demanding task.
First, you'll want to confirm the current balance of elements within the furnace and compare it to your desired result.${prompt}
Next, you can begin to ${color: 5}feed fewell${color: 1} into the furnace to gradually raise the level of elemental concentration.
Feeding fewell into the furnace until the required elemental balance is achieved is the most fundamental operation of synergy.${prompt}
However, high concentrations of elemental power can lead to volatile and unpredictable reactions.
Simply adding fewell haphazardly without making the necessary adjustments is a recipe for only one thing, and that's disaster.${prompt}

If you sense that the furnace is on the verge of elemental overload, you'll want to employ the ${color: 5}safety lever${color: 1} and ${color: 5}pressure handle${color: 1} to prevent an unfortunate accident from occurring.${prompt}
You'll also want to mind the laws of elemental ascendancy and opposition.
Increasing the concentration of a particular element will cause its counterpart to decrease.${prompt}
The furnace cannot sustain its power indefinitely, and will gradually lose durability as the synergy process continues.
You'll need to perform periodic ${color: 5}furnace repair${color: 1} should the furnace near its breaking point.${prompt}
It is also possible to ${color: 5}recycle strewn fewell${color: 1} during synergy.
While this will not impact the success or failure of the process itself, it will result in a greater amount of salvageable cinder produced as a by-product.${prompt}
This cinder is of great interest to our researchers back at the institute.
As such, we have introduced a reward system through which quality samples can be traded in for an assortment of synergy-related wares.${prompt}
As marvelous an apparatus as the synergy furnace may be, keep in mind that the technology is still in its infancy, and highly unstable.
There may be times when accidents occur despite the best efforts of the synergist.${prompt}
For your safety, we recommend stepping as far away from the furnace as possible at the first sign of danger.
Some synergists claim that giving the furnace a good thwack is also effective in preventing such accidents, but this is pure madness, if you ask me!${prompt}
You will also find that there are numerous techniques that can be applied to make the synergy procedure go even more smoothly.${prompt}
In many cases, expertise and knowledge acquired through crafting will serve you in synergy as well.
To truly master synergy, one must master crafting as well.${prompt}
Now let us return to the synergy process itself.
As your elemental balance approaches that prescribed by the recipe, the furnace will signal you, and you may retrieve your finished product.${prompt}
If the furnace is still holding strong at this time, you may choose to keep working to achieve an even closer balance.
The closer you come to the ideal balance, the higher the quality of your finished product will be.${prompt}
Indeed, many synergy masters consider these waning moments after the signal to be the time to really show off their skills!
Why, if they manage to achieve an elemental surge...${prompt}
What's an elemental surge, you ask?
Why, it's a miraculous phenomenon that occurs rarely--ever so rarely--upon feeding the furnace fewell.${prompt}

The elements react just in the right way, creating a miraculous reaction that brings the level of elemental concentration to exactly the desired level. Truly a boon from the Goddess for any synergist, no?${prompt}
...And that is the synergy process in a nutshell.
There's quite a bit of information to take in, so don't hesitate to return any time for a refresher course.${prompt}
Much like synthesis, to fashion items through synergy, you will need to follow a recipe.
We synergy engineers are always unearthing new recipes, and are happy to share with you those suitable for your level of skill.${prompt}
Unlike synthesis, however, a synergy recipe is more than just a list of ingredients.
There is also a required elemental balance that must be attained to achieve your desired result.${prompt}

Simple recipes involve only small doses of a limited number of elements, but more complex ones require the synergist to skillfully juggle wide ranges of elements in extremely high concentrations.${prompt}
The ingredients, you will have to remember on your own.
The required elemental balance, however, may be reviewed at any time during the synergy process by observing the readings on the synergy furnace.${prompt}

In particular, recipes through which the curious substance known as ${item-singular: 0[2]} can be attached to equipment are creating quite a buzz among synergistically inclined adventurers these days.${prompt}
First, equipment must be prepared by etching an aperture into which an elementally compatible piece of ${item-singular: 0[2]} can then be embedded.${prompt}
The type of aperture that may be etched will depend on the piece of equipment.
There are also pieces of equipment that, alas, may not be modified at all.${prompt}
If you are curious what manner of aperture may be etched into a particular piece of equipment, you need only trade it to me or one of my colleagues.${prompt}
As a general rule, the higher the level of the item in question, the more difficult the synergy process for creating an aperture will be.${prompt}
You will find that certain pieces of equipment may be etched with multiple apertures.
It is, however, only possible to create one aperture at a time.${prompt}
Etching requires the use of a corrosive substance we call mordant.
Deposit mordant into a synergy furnace along with your equipment, and the process will begin.${prompt}
My colleagues and I have a stock of mordant available for sale.
The best way to learn is to practice, so if you're curious, we encourage you to purchase some and begin experimenting!${prompt}
The difficulty of the synergy process when embedding evolith is decided by a number of factors.${prompt}
Such factors include the variety of aperture and evolith, as well as the quantity of evolith you seek to attach.
Embedding the first piece is not too difficult a task, but the second and third pieces will not go in so easily.${prompt}
To begin the embedding process, deposit your evolith into the synergy furnace along with a piece of equipment with a compatible aperture.${prompt}
When etching or embedding, the required elemental balance may be confirmed at any time during the synergy process, so let this be your guide.${prompt}
Should you ever wish to remove any apertures and embedded evolith from a piece of equipment entirely, you may do so with an ingredient we call ${color: 5}revertant${color: 1}.${prompt}
Toss the revertant in a synergy furnace along with your equipment, and its potent powers will restore your item to a pure and pristine state!
Be warned, however, that embedded evolith will be lost forever in the process.${prompt}
As you are no doubt already aware, synergy makes use of a highly combustible form of elemental crystals that we call “fewell.”
The more complex the recipe, the greater the quantity of fewell required.${prompt}
Veteran synergists know well the hassle of having to constantly monitor their fewell supply and procure crystals to replenish depleted stock.${prompt}
To free you of such trifling burdens and allow you to focus your mind entirely on your art, we synergy engineers are offering a convenient fewell replenishment service!${prompt}
For a nominal fee calculated based upon the current state of your fewell reserves, we will instantly refill you to full capacity.${prompt}
That's right--all elements in one simple transaction, directly to your ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}!
Looking to fire up your furnace and enter the world of ${item-singular: 0[2]}?
If so, you've come to the right place!${prompt}
We're proud to offer a supply of the corrosive agent known as ${color: 5}mordant${color: 1} for sale.
With this, synergy newcomers can hone their skills and outfit their equipment with evolith-capable apertures in the process.${prompt}
Mind you, our stock is limited to only the most diluted, readily produced form of the stuff.
You'll find that it only has the strength to etch items of relatively low level.${prompt}
Etching high-powered equipment requires the use of more concentrated and potent forms of mordant.
As quantities are limited, we can offer these only in exchange for cinder.${prompt}
Those handy tricks of the trade that can mean the difference between a shiny new item and a major furnace meltdown.${prompt}
My colleagues and I are always eager to train fellow synergists in a wide range of techniques.
We can't do it all, though--you'll need to hone your synergy skill in order to benefit from our instruction.${prompt}
Bear in mind that certain techniques can only be imparted to students possessing specialized crafting knowledge.
For example, only skilled smiths will be able to comprehend the method for more efficient fewell feeding.${prompt}
Accomplished goldsmiths will be able to observe the inner workings of the furnace and stave off potential accidents.
You will find that all crafting skills--even those you may not expect--may be applied in some way to support the synergy process.${prompt}
Word has it that there are also pieces of equipment that can impart hidden synergy techniques to the wearer.
These, too, are said to be only accessible to skilled crafters.${prompt}
The moral of the story is this: while synergy skill is important, neglect not your other crafting skills.
To become a true synergy master, finding the proper balance is key.${prompt}
Synergy remains a young discipline, and researchers back at the institute are burning the midnight fewell in the hopes of uncovering the next breakthrough in our field.${prompt}
Research of late is centered around the cinder that is left behind as a by-product of each synergy operation.
Their composition, it would seem, has much to teach us of the true nature of the complex elemental reactions that go on within the bellies of these furnaces.${prompt}
We've even instituted a reward program for adventurers willing to contribute prime samples in the name of science.${prompt}
It would be no exaggeration to say that, to us, cinder is worth more than its weight in gold!
Bring it to me or my colleagues--preferably in large quantities--and you're sure to be pleased at what we can offer you in return.${prompt}

Do you love synergizing as much as I love synergizing!?
'Cause if you do, you're gonna loooooove the recipes I have for you!${prompt}
View recipes for which skill level?
Oh, the ${item-singular: 0[2]}? Why, that's one of my favorite recipes, too!

A life without intellectual curiosity is a life hardly worth living.

Synergy is both an art and a science: an evolution--nay, a revolution--in synthesis.${prompt}

Using ${keyitem-article: 0[2]} in conjunction with a synergy furnace--the apparatus you see beside me--the synergist wields the power of myriad elements to fabricate a veritable host of potent items.${prompt}

Synergy furnaces have been installed throughout the city for the use of all synergists.

The synergist must provide his or her own ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}, as well as any materials to be used in the synergy process.

Ah, ${name-player}. You have chosen a most opportune time to pay visit.${prompt}

Might I trouble you to accept the letter, that folk residing on the mainland would know that Tavnazia shares in their joy?${prompt}

Phrase en Français: To make use of my services, first you'll need to buy one of these storage slips for the low, low fee of ${number: 19} gil.${prompt}

Choose the item you wish to entrust, then trade it to me along with a single storage slip.
I will take the item and return the slip to you, marked with an invisible seal.${prompt}
It's plain as day to us moogles, so don't even think of trying to pull one over on us, kupo.${prompt}
When it comes time to retrieve your item, just trade to me a single storage slip--any slip--once again.${prompt}
I will present you with a list of all the items currently in my care, and you may choose the one you wish to withdraw.

Pretty generous of us for a change, no?${prompt}
Now I bet you're wondering what the catch is, kupo.
So as not to disappoint you, there are a few!${prompt}

It's better for both of us if you keep your most precious possessions close at hand, kupo.${prompt}
Now listen up, because there's another catch, and it's a doozy.${prompt}
If you lose your storage slip, I won't be able to return your item. Ever. No ifs, ands, or buts!
No “I'm sorry, Mister Porter Moogle, it'll never happen again!”
Rules are rules, kupo, and someone has to keep them.${prompt}

If you have such an item that you're simply dying to entrust to me, you'll have to abandon your trial first, kupo.${prompt}
And that's all there is to it.
This humble moogle can hardly wait to serve you!${prompt}
Do we have a deal, kupo?${prompt}

Atmacite is best described as the crystalline agglomeration of a creature's soul.
Our scientists have succeeded in discovering a way to tap its power to serve the efforts of the Voidwatch.${prompt}
By infusing one's body with atmacite, it is possible to obtain powers akin to those once possessed by the creature whence it came, rather like turning a beast's fangs upon its own kind.${prompt}

At first glance, atmacite appears to be the perfect artificial enhancement. However, it does suffer from a single limitation: its power is unleashed only when engaged in a Voidwatch operation.${prompt}
Research to identify the exact reason for this continues, but most scientists find the spectral alignment theory compelling.${prompt}
That is, being formed of Voidwalker souls, atmacite will surge to life only when its bearer is existentially aligned to its dimension of origin.${prompt}
From this it can be inferred that Voidwalkers are stripped of considerable strength when they cross over into Vana'diel.${prompt}
But I suspect this is of little interest to a layman like you. Allow me to return to the subject at hand.${prompt}
The infusion of atmacite requires cruor, a potent energy source that takes the form of shiny red granules.${prompt}
Cruor is obtainable by various means, felling a Voidwalker being the most common of all.
As you can never have too much cruor, I urge you to be diligent in its procurement.${prompt}
We've recently perfected a method for improving atmacite potency. The process is called enrichment, and involves fusing cruor on to atmacite to amplify its power.${prompt}
Atmacite can be enriched in stages up to a maximum of level ${number: 0}. The quantity of cruor required varies with the variety of atmacite as well as its current enrichment level.${prompt}
Under normal conditions, atmacite enrichment is an intensive process that demands trained hands.
For reasons yet to be determined, however, both infusion and enrichment can be safely performed by laymen, provided they're at a planar rift.${prompt}
Keep this in mind should the need arise to reconfigure your atmacite with haste.${prompt}

I've been dispatched from many malms away on a very important mission.${prompt}
“What might that objective be,” you ask?
One as heroically challenged as you need not concern yourself with it.${prompt}
I've been dispatched from many malms away on a very important mission.
“What sort of mission,” you ask? An astute question indeed!
And here I'd begun to lose hope of meeting any capable adventurers in these provincial backwaters.${prompt}
(Yes, I hail from Jeuno, but we can't let the riffraff around these parts be privy to that information.)${prompt}
Oh, come now. I'm certain ${choice-player-gender}[a hero/a heroine] of your caliber could figure it out.
The secrecy, the mention of <cough> Jeuno <cough>, propositioning adventurers...${prompt}
Yes, it does indeed involve Voidwalkers--those eerie menaces that traverse time and space by way of those “planar rifts.”
I haven't the foggiest idea as to why, but they've apparently decided to make Tavnazia their next battlefront.${prompt}
I was given an order to dispose of the threat, effective immediately.
However, these fishmongering philistines...how do I put this politely? Show no respect for the Voidwatch's jurisdiction.${prompt}
No matter how civil I try to be around these country bumpkins, they simply won't let me do my job.
Thus I've been secretly recruiting adventurers to aid in our cause.${prompt}
What say you take pity on a fellow crusader of justice and help rid this wasteland of its interdimensional intruders?${prompt}
I've heard much about you from Justinius.${prompt}
One of those being that your exploits factored heavily in Jeuno's decision to trade with this region.${prompt}
In that sense, one could say it's your doing--for better or worse--that I've been dispatched to this goddess-forsaken crag.${prompt}

I have a proposition, but I warn you--this task is more harrowing than listening to your mother-in-law berate you over a deceptively cordial cup of tea about how you don't spend enough time with your wife. Even now, I can see her eyes...bearing into my soul...as her venomous tongue paralyzes me like a death jacket's stinger. Die! Die, you accursed fiend!${prompt}
This mission actually involves Voidwalkers. According to the Tavnazian Patrol, planar rifts have been opening up across the archipelago recently.${prompt}
What they see in this piddling swath of scattered rocks, I haven't a clue.${prompt}
(Still, if they can find a mound of rubble like Tavnazia habitable, what's stopping them from infesting every area in the realm?)${prompt}
In summation, we need your assistance in exterminating these pests.${prompt}
What do you say? Will you do your part for the Voidwatch?${prompt}
It would seem everyone in these parts is a lily-livered craven. It must be something in the water...${prompt}
Whoa, whoa, whoa! There's something I need to get off my chest.
I figured no one in this dirthole would be brave enough to sign up, so I didn't bother reading the recruitment manual.${prompt}
It pains me to admit my own ignorance, but you'll have to seek out a Voidwatch Officer if you want some answers.${prompt}
Did you finally grow a backbone?
Now are you ready to join the Voidwatch and make the realm proud?${prompt}
People say I sound like a pompous jackanapes, but at least I know how to give thanks.
Your help will be more than welcome in the Uleguerand Range, Lufaise Meadows, Attohwa Chasm, and on the Misareaux Coast.${prompt}
You'll need this ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} for your operations as well.
Take it. Don't hold back on my account.${prompt}
However, this won't be of much use unless you're also in possession of ${keyitem-article: 0[2]}...or so my superiors tell me.
Very well then. May you save the realm and one day depart this bastion of boors.${prompt}
Remember, you can always come to me for help should backcountry life prove too stressful. If nothing else, we can always bemoan our terrible fates together.${prompt}

You have yet to complete all of your objectives. I wish you the best of luck.${prompt}
Voidwalkers have reappeared at Lufaise Meadows, Misareaux Coast, Uleguerand Range, ${choice: 0}[and Attohwa Chasm/Attohwa Chasm, and Bibiki Bay].
Keep your chin up! With your help, we'll put an end to this Voidwalker invasion yet! ...I hope.${prompt}
My compatriots within the 'Watch tell me that you've exterminated every last threat to the archipelago. Admirably done.${prompt}
...But we both know the old adage about assuming.

Only greenhorns and village idiots fail to realize that these creatures possess an uncanny ability to revive as if they'd never suffered a scratch. If only we could decipher the manner in which they cheat death...${prompt}
If Voidwalkers can resurrect...then my mission will never end!
I don't want to be trapped on this isolated archipelago for eternity! What will my hydrangeas ever do without me!?${prompt}
You know what might turn the tide of this fathomless bloodbath? A war of attrition!
If you could return every so often to slay these undying anomalies, we might yet be able to terminate the Voidwalkers once and for all!${prompt}
Were you aware that the inhabitants of this land finally decided to open trade with Jeuno?${prompt}
Though I often speak ill of them, truth is the locals are rather open-minded and accepting, though a tad unsophisticated.${prompt}
Even Justinius of the Tavnazia Patrol has proven quite cooperative.${prompt}
Speaking of Justinius, it would behoove us to inform him of your victories.${prompt}
You're a credit to adventurers everywhere. Justinius certainly knows a capable ${choice-player-gender}[man/woman] when he sees one.
Speaking of Justinius, it would behoove us to inform him of your victories.${prompt}
I'll tell you where I'll put my hooves if you're gonna keep secrets from me!${prompt}
I knew you could do it, ${name-player}! No one can come close to matching your awesomeness!${prompt}
Misareaux mantraps! Who might you be!?${prompt}
I see you're at it again, ${name-player}.
We all know how powerful you are, so how about throwing the patrol a bone every once in a while? We're dying for some good press!${prompt}
Justinius has told me all about your exploits.
You're always there for Tavnazia when it needs you, ${name-player}. Thanks.${prompt}
Although, I guess it should only be a matter of time before we get our due, what with all the Voidwalkers crawling around Tavnazia lately.${prompt}
But Voidwalkers tend to reappear like maggots on meat, right?${prompt}
Just you wait! We'll cut down so many of those mystical invaders that...well, there won't be any left for you!${prompt}
Maybe this's the Tavnazian Patrol's chance to get some good press of our own!${prompt}
This is hardly the time to be engaging in idle chatter! Your studies await!${prompt}
For crying out loud, Ulmia, you've become more of a curmudgeon than Despachiaire!${prompt}
It's wonderful to see you in such high spirits, ${name-player}. I always knew in my heart of hearts that we would meet again.${prompt}
As you can see, Prishe is as lively as she's ever been.${prompt}
Who knows where she, I, and all of Tavnazia would be without you, ${name-player}.
Please return to visit us again sometime. Preferably after Prishe's lessons are finished.${prompt}
I should have known that being an adventurer is about having gil and ${choice-player-gender}[dames/beaus] scattered all over the realm.${prompt}
...Phew, what a relief that's over. I've withstood tempest gales with less destructive power than that diminutive rapscallion she tutors.${prompt}
That diminutive girl was Prishe, correct? Perhaps all the rumors were all simply...rumors.${prompt}
Well, you have my thanks for a job well done.
I highly doubt you'll be receiving any accolades from the uncouth citizens of this cesspool, but I shall make sure word of your tremendous deeds reaches Jeuno.${prompt}

If you'll permit me to spread some titillating gossip, I do believe that Prishe girl was shouting something along the lines of "Bibiki Bay or bust!" before making a rather exuberant departure.${prompt}
Supposedly, this Prishe girl has left the Safehold for Bibiki Bay.${prompt}
I would enjoy hearing how she plans to travel all the way to Mindartia, however. Since Bibiki Bay lies on that continent, such sorcery should be nigh impossible!${prompt}
The same way you did, you say? Through a chaotically churning portal of such despairing darkness that--${prompt}

...And why in the Goddess's name has that ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} changed!?${prompt}

Wait...does that Prishe girl intend to help us quell the Voidwalker threat?${prompt}
I predict choppy seas ahead if you plan on sailing into the eye of her storm again. May you stay the course and remain unscathed...${prompt}
I swear, that pixie is hellsbent on dragging the Tavnazian Patrol through the deepest puddle of mud she can find...${prompt}
I take it no one has divulged anything to the citizenry about the matter in question...?${prompt}

We must uncover the truth behind this phenomenon, and quickly.${prompt}

I trust you realize what those two were discussing.

Although now that the Voidwalkers are gone, I should be getting orders to ship out any day now.
Please let it be today, please let it be today...${prompt}

Rally the troops. I will contact Jeuno immediately.${prompt}

${name-player}? I wanted to go see you myself, but things've been heating up out here.${prompt}

I'd bet gil to greedies that Mildaurion and the Zilart would be chomping at the bit to get their hands on it.${prompt}

Speaking of, you been to see her yet?${prompt}
They chose her to participate, and what does she do? Run around like a chocobo with its head cut off, blubbering about “violation of privacy” or whatever.${prompt}
Why she's so embarrassed about alter egos is beyond me. She can sure belt out a tune, so imagine a full ensemble of six or seven Ulmias!${prompt}
You actually got her to go along with it!?${prompt}
I didn't think you had it in you! She was so flustered by the whole thing, I figured she'd crumble at the mere suggestion of it. Well done, pal!${prompt}
But let's get back to what matters--your relationship with me.${prompt}
I was only vaguely paying attention to the damned lecture the institute gave me, but they said something about bonds of friendship and trust being the key.${prompt}
“Trust”? Hah! We've got so much more than that.${prompt}
After all, which dynamic duo saved the world from ruin at the hands of Promathia?${prompt}
If I couldn't trust you, why would I let you out of my sight for a minute? No, it's more than trust--it's destiny!${prompt}
Ah, crap...but there's more to it than that. There's also friendship, too.${prompt}
Now that I think about it, I remember a time when some old jeweler over in Jeuno was going on and on about what “love” really is.${prompt}
You know what I learned from him? That love ain't something you know about until it hits you. So that means I don't know what love is?${prompt}
But I recall sharing something with a certain young girl...${prompt}
Animals have hearts and souls, just like people do, and their hearts are much more pure than ours.${prompt}
Now if only I were as pure as a moogle, then maybe...${prompt}
Ah, screw it all! What's this weird heat coming from my cheeks?${prompt}
${choice: 2}[Well, then/Hmm... Come to think of it], the two of us make one hell of a team, don't you agree?${prompt}
Although a certain someone yelled at me not to leap without looking all the time.${prompt}

You'd picture he'd've just told me to be careful, but oh no!${prompt}
If it were you in a pit of snakes, though, I wouldn't care what any old fart would have to say! I'd throw myself in after you in a heartbeat!${prompt}
${choice: 2}[Well, the/Let's continue. The] two of us can lick any problem, big or small.${prompt}
The Shadow Lord, Kam'lanaut, Eald'narche, Nag'Molada...doesn't matter one bit to me.${prompt}
They may have succumbed--but we didn't. And you remember why, don't you?${prompt}
The light that brought us into this world shines brighter than the sun, and continues to bless the world, its people, and our hearts.${prompt}
${choice: 2}[Getting down to business,/With all that said,] let's get the show on the road!${prompt}
Can't be that hard, right? A little bim, bam, boom, and off we go!${prompt}

'Course, that'll mean I'll have to double up on meals. Heh heh.${prompt}
And if I'll be by your side the whole time, I'm gonna need a whole safehold full of dhalmel steaks!${prompt}
It'd be nice if I could head out on another adventure with you myself...${prompt}
But I'm sure this one here can handle it.${prompt}
Just keep her safe and fed, and she'll kick the snot out of anything that gets in your way!${prompt}
